result.eng: The accommodaton costs were higher than we thought.

result.orig: Bhí costas an lóistín níos airde ná mar a cheap muid
result.html: Bhí costas an lóistín níos airde ná mar a cheap muidThe accommodaton costs were higher than we thought.
result.ponchtml: Ḃí costas an lóistín níos airde ná mar a ċeap muidThe accommodaton costs were higher than we thought.

result.eng: What do you think?
result.ga: Cad a cheapann tú
result.orig: Cad a cheapann tú
result.html: Cad a cheapann túWhat do you think?
result.ponchtml: Cad a ċeapann túWhat do you think?

result.eng: She was appointed chairperson.
result.ga: Ceapadh ina cathaoirleach í
result.orig: Ceapadh ina cathaoirleach í
result.html: Ceapadh ina cathaoirleach íShe was appointed chairperson.
result.ponchtml: Ceapaḋ ina caṫaoirleaċ íShe was appointed chairperson.

result.eng: He was appointed professor.

result.orig: Ceapadh ina ollamh é
result.html: Ceapadh ina ollamh éHe was appointed professor.
result.ponchtml: Ceapaḋ ina ollaṁ éHe was appointed professor.

result.eng: It was designed as an electronic dictionary.

result.ponchtml: Ceapaḋ mar ḟoclóir leictreoaċ éIt was designed as an electronic dictionary.

result.eng: I think she hates me.
result.ga: Ceapaim go bhfuil an ghráin aici orm
result.orig: Ceapaim go bhfuil an ghráin aici orm
result.html: Ceapaim go bhfuil an ghráin aici ormI think she hates me.
result.ponchtml: Ceapaim go ḃfuil an ġráin aici ormI think she hates me.

result.eng: I think it is excellent.
result.ga: Ceapaim go bhfuil sé go hiontach
result.orig: Ceapaim go bhfuil sé go hiontach
result.html: Ceapaim go bhfuil sé go hiontachI think it is excellent.
result.ponchtml: Ceapaim go ḃfuil sé go hiontaċI think it is excellent.

result.eng: I think you're spending too much time in the pub.
result.ga: Ceapaim go bhfuil tú ag caitheamh barraíocht ama sa teach tábhairne
result.orig: Ceapaim go bhfuil tú ag caitheamh barraíocht ama sa teach tábhairne
result.html: Ceapaim go bhfuil tú ag caitheamh barraíocht ama sa teach tábhairneI think you're spending too much time in the pub.
result.ponchtml: Ceapaim go ḃfuil tú ag caiṫeaṁ barraíoċt ama sa teaċ táḃairneI think you're spending too much time in the pub.

result.eng: They appointed him president.
result.ga: Cheap siad ina uachtarán é
result.orig: Cheap siad ina uachtarán é
result.html: Cheap siad ina uachtarán éThey appointed him president.
result.ponchtml: Ċeap siad ina uaċtarán éThey appointed him president.

result.eng: You'd think from their talk that they had sex every night.
result.ga: Cheapfá óna gcuid cainte go raibh siad ag bualadh craicinn gach oíche
result.orig: Cheapfá óna gcuid cainte go raibh siad ag bualadh craicinn gach oíche

result.ponchtml: Ċeapfá óna gcuid cainte go raiḃ siad ag bualaḋ craicinn gaċ oíċeYou'd think from their talk that they had sex every night.

result.eng: I almost thought I wouldn't be paid.
result.ga: Is beag a cheap mé go n-íocfaí mé
result.orig: Is beag a cheap mé go n-íocfaí mé
result.html: Is beag a cheap mé go n-íocfaí méI almost thought I wouldn't be paid.
result.ponchtml: Is beag a ċeap mé go n-íocfaí méI almost thought I wouldn't be paid.

result.eng: I don't care what people think.
result.ga: Is cuma liom cad a cheapann daoine
result.orig: Is cuma liom cad a cheapann daoine
result.html: Is cuma liom cad a cheapann daoineI don't care what people think.
result.ponchtml: Is cuma liom cad a ċeapann daoineI don't care what people think.

result.eng: The plan is designed to promote cooperation between the member states.
result.ga: Tá an plean seo ceaptha chun comhar a chothú idir na ballstáit

result.ponchtml: Tá an plean seo ceapṫa ċun coṁar a ċoṫú idir na ballstáitThe plan is designed to promote cooperation between the member states.

result.eng: This is way bigger than I thought.
result.ga: Tá sé seo i bhfad Éireann níos mó ná mar a cheap mé
result.orig: Tá sé seo i bhfad Éireann níos mó ná mar a cheap mé

result.ponchtml: Tá sé seo i ḃfad Éireann níos mó ná mar a ċeap méThis is way bigger than I thought.

result.eng: I have no reason to believe they didn't know each other.
result.ga: Níl aon údar agamsa lena cheapadh nach raibh aithne acu ar a chéile
result.orig: Níl aon údar agamsa lena cheapadh nach raibh aithne acu ar a chéile

result.ponchtml: Níl aon údar agamsa lena ċeapaḋ naċ raiḃ aiṫne acu ar a ċéileI have no reason to believe they didn't know each other.

result.eng: Some people never stop laughing at them.
result.ga: Tá siad de shíor ina gceap magaidh ag daoine áirithe
result.orig: Tá siad de shíor ina gceap magaidh ag daoine áirithe
result.html: Tá siad de shíor ina gceap magaidh ag daoine áiritheSome people never stop laughing at them.
result.ponchtml: Tá siad de ẛíor ina gceap magaiḋ ag daoine áiriṫeSome people never stop laughing at them.

result.eng: It wasn't my idea.
result.ga: Ní mise a chum ná a cheap
result.orig: Ní mise a chum ná a cheap
result.html: Ní mise a chum ná a cheapIt wasn't my idea.
result.ponchtml: Ní mise a ċum ná a ċeapIt wasn't my idea.

result.eng: He makes a laughing stock out of Ireland.
result.ga: Déanann sé ceap magaidh d'Éirinn
result.orig: Déanann sé ceap magaidh d'Éirinn
result.html: Déanann sé ceap magaidh d'ÉirinnHe makes a laughing stock out of Ireland.
result.ponchtml: Déanann sé ceap magaiḋ d'ÉirinnHe makes a laughing stock out of Ireland.

result.eng: It was she who turned us and our faith into a laughing stock!
result.ga: Ise a rinne ceap magaidh dínne agus dár gcreideamh
result.orig: Ise a rinne ceap magaidh dínne agus dár gcreideamh
result.html: Ise a rinne ceap magaidh dínne agus dár gcreideamhIt was she who turned us and our faith into a laughing stock!
result.ponchtml: Ise a rinne ceap magaiḋ dínne agus dár gcreideaṁIt was she who turned us and our faith into a laughing stock!

result.eng: It is time to appoint a new minister.
result.ga: Tá sé in am aire nua a cheapadh
result.orig: Tá sé in am aire nua a cheapadh
result.html: Tá sé in am aire nua a cheapadhIt is time to appoint a new minister.
result.ponchtml: Tá sé in am aire nua a ċeapaḋIt is time to appoint a new minister.

result.eng: He was his school friends' laughing stock.
result.ga: Bhí sé ina cheap magaidh ag a chomhscoláirí
result.orig: Bhí sé ina cheap magaidh ag a chomhscoláirí
result.html: Bhí sé ina cheap magaidh ag a chomhscoláiríHe was his school friends' laughing stock.
result.ponchtml: Ḃí sé ina ċeap magaiḋ ag a ċoṁscoláiríHe was his school friends' laughing stock.

result.eng: They turn a good cause into an object of ridicule.
result.ga: Tiontaíonn siad cúis mhaith ina ceap áiféise
result.orig: Tiontaíonn siad cúis mhaith ina ceap áiféise
result.html: Tiontaíonn siad cúis mhaith ina ceap áiféiseThey turn a good cause into an object of ridicule.
result.ponchtml: Tiontaíonn siad cúis ṁaiṫ ina ceap áiféiseThey turn a good cause into an object of ridicule.

result.eng: They say every group needs somebody to blame.
result.ga: Deirtear go bhfuil gá le ceap milleáin ag gach grúpa
result.orig: Deirtear go bhfuil gá le ceap milleáin ag gach grúpa
result.html: Deirtear go bhfuil gá le ceap milleáin ag gach grúpaThey say every group needs somebody to blame.
result.ponchtml: Deirtear go ḃfuil gá le ceap milleáin ag gaċ grúpaThey say every group needs somebody to blame.

result.eng: The needs are putting the blame on us.
result.ga: Tá na meáin ag déanamh ceap milleáin asainn
result.orig: Tá na meáin ag déanamh ceap milleáin asainn
result.html: Tá na meáin ag déanamh ceap milleáin asainnThe needs are putting the blame on us.
result.ponchtml: Tá na meáin ag déanaṁ ceap milleáin asainnThe needs are putting the blame on us.

result.eng: She is the talk of the town.
result.ga: Tá sí ina ceap cainte ag an mbaile
result.orig: Tá sí ina ceap cainte ag an mbaile
result.html: Tá sí ina ceap cainte ag an mbaileShe is the talk of the town.
result.ponchtml: Tá sí ina ceap cainte ag an mbaileShe is the talk of the town.

result.eng: I kept that pile of papers in the corner of my table.
result.ga: Choinnigh mé an ceap páipéir sin ar chúinne an bhoird
result.orig: Choinnigh mé an ceap páipéir sin ar chúinne an bhoird
result.html: Choinnigh mé an ceap páipéir sin ar chúinne an bhoirdI kept that pile of papers in the corner of my table.
result.ponchtml: Ċoinniġ mé an ceap páipéir sin ar ċúinne an ḃoirdI kept that pile of papers in the corner of my table.

result.eng: He thought he'd faint from the sickness.
result.ga: Cheap sé go dtitfeadh sé i laige leis an tinneas
result.orig: Cheap sé go dtitfeadh sé i laige leis an tinneas
result.html: Cheap sé go dtitfeadh sé i laige leis an tinneasHe thought he'd faint from the sickness.
result.ponchtml: Ċeap sé go dtitfeaḋ sé i laige leis an tinneasHe thought he'd faint from the sickness.

result.eng: I thought it was silly of us to argue.
result.ga: Cheap mé gur sheafóideach an mhaise dúinn a bheith ag argóint

result.html: Cheap mé gur sheafóideach an mhaise dúinn a bheith ag argóintI thought it was silly of us to argue.
result.ponchtml: Ċeap mé gur ẛeafóideaċ an ṁaise dúinn a ḃeiṫ ag argóintI thought it was silly of us to argue.

result.eng: There are people who'd think the two things are related.
result.ga: Táthar ann a cheapfadh go bhfuil baint idir an dá rud

result.ponchtml: Táṫar ann a ċeapfaḋ go ḃfuil baint idir an dá rudThere are people who'd think the two things are related.

result.eng: They made up a new name for her.
result.ga: Cheap siad ainm nua di
result.orig: Cheap siad ainm nua di
result.html: Cheap siad ainm nua diThey made up a new name for her.
result.ponchtml: Ċeap siad ainm nua diThey made up a new name for her.

result.eng: He used to claim that it was self-instruction that enabled him to conceive unusual ideas.
result.ga: Mhaíodh sé gurbh é an féinoideachas a chuir ar a chumas aige smaointe neamhghnácha a cheapadh
result.orig: Mhaíodh sé gurbh é an féinoideachas a chuir ar a chumas aige smaointe neamhghnácha a cheapadh
